[

Casual Teacher - Migrant English

Company Name Swinburne University of Technology Company Location Hawthorn, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 309 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Swinburne is a progressive university that aims to increase Australia’s capacity in science, technology and innovation as the drivers of modern, internationalised economies and workplaces. Our university is focused on high-impact global research, high-quality teaching and active engagement with both industry and the community.

About the department
Swinburne’s Pathways to Vocational Education has five departments, which offer vocational programs at post-graduate, advanced diploma, diploma, certificate and basic vocational levels.

The Health & Science Department incorporates the following program areas:

• Early Childhood and Education
• Nursing and Health Services
• Community Services
• Laboratory Technologies and Science
• Migrant English
• General Education

About the job
The Swinburne PAVE Teacher is required to inspire, engage and educate our students for the 21st century. A PAVE teacher will implement industry best practice and apply current learning technologies and contemporary learning pedagogies. The PAVE teacher will work collaboratively within a team of education professionals. Within this team environment, they will plan deliver, assess, evaluate and ensure compliance of high quality education and training programs. This role requires our teachers to be able to customise and adapt our programs to meet our learners and clients’ needs that vary from certificate level through to diploma and associate degree levels.

About you
To be successful in the role, you will have:

  • Certificate IV in Training and Assessment (TAE40110 or its successor)
  • Post Graduate qualification in Teaching English to Speakers of other Languages (TESOL) or equivalent.
  • Demonstrated experience or the capacity to develop learning and assessment resources.

A full list of the selection criteria is available within the position description

Benefits\xa0
The diverse culture within Swinburne is a source of strength. We have an inclusive working environment with employees from a variety of backgrounds. We acknowledge that diversity in the university workforce increases the effectiveness of teams and our capacity for innovation. We welcome applications from Indigenous people, workers of all ages, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ and those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

We are proud to be recognised by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality 2018 and of key initiatives such as our Pride@Swinburne Strategic Action Plan and our Reconciliation Action Plan which are integral components of our 2025 vision to be world class university creating social and economic impact through science, technology and innovation. Swinburne has also received the Victorian “High Commendation” Multicultural Excellence Award (Business Category).

Further information, contacts and support
To start an application click on 'begin' at the bottom of this page and submit a resume, cover letter and response to the Key Selection Criteria, as listed in the Position Description below.
Please do not email or send paper applications, all applications must be submitted online.

For further information about the position, please contact Alyce Ratsasane (Recruitment Consultant) on aratsasane@swin.edu.au.

If you are experiencing technical difficulties with your application, please contact the Recruitment team on staffrecruitment@swin.edu.au

Should you require further support for an interview due to special needs or consideration, please contact our Diversity Consultant, Dr. Walter Robles, on inclusion@swin.edu.au, or our Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Employment Officer, Sherrin Trautmann on DeadlyCareers@swin.edu.au.

Applications close at 11.30pm, Sunday 30th September 2018.

For further details on How to Apply, including Hints & Tips, please refer to our Frequently Asked Questions section.

You will work with a supportive team where there is ongoing knowledge sharing and project interaction.


Your key objectives will include:


    • Delivery of high quality customer facing mobile solutions that customers love to use
    • Contributing to the technical strategy of the team with advice on frameworks, methodologies and platforms
    • Helping ensure that ongoing quality of our products is managed and addressed through collaboration with our QA resources

    The skills and experience we're looking for:

855148365:
[

Junior Backend Developer

Company Name Ignite Online Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 16 hours ago Number of views 67 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Are you a recent graduate/born coder, looking to learn from a leading Melbourne-based digital agency, with a real desire to work as an integral part of a fast-growing team producing epic outcomes?

Ignite Online (igniteonline.com.au) is a web design and digital marketing company based in Collingwood, working out of the inspiring co-working space, 'The Commons' (thecommons.io). We are looking for an experienced junior backend developer with a love of all things online. Your role will be diverse, and you are sure to learn a lot! Check out our Instagram @igniteonline for more of an idea about what we do.

We're looking for somebody passionate about working with us to create and manage innovative digital solutions for our clients! We work with some amazing clients you've heard of like Capi, Melbourne Girls Grammar, AFL Players Association to name a few.

IS THIS YOU?

  • You are a 'learn-it-all' not a 'know-it-all', keen to learn & grow every day.
  • You love coding so much, you're working on your own projects right now in your own time on weeknights or weekends, or taking part in hackathons.
  • You have strong initiative\xa0
  • You love to learn by experimenting, reading books, listening to podcasts or attending\xa0events
  • You pride yourself on your\xa0excellent written and verbal communication and relationship building skills.
  • Near enough is not good enough, you have an eye for detail and strive for perfection.
  • You love your computer,\xa0being online in general and get excited to\xa0test new code and development methodologies.
  • You're a team player that loves to collaborate to get the best results.
  • You are self-motivated and able to work autonomously for periods of time.
  • You're passionate about being organised and planned, armed with your 'to do' lists and timelines.
  • A sense of humour is always welcome!


DO YOU HAVE THESE SKILLS?


  • Some skills in, JavaScript frameworks such as Vue.js or React, HTML5, CSS3

  • Some experience in server-side JavaScript with Node.js\xa0

  • Understanding of Coding best practices - OOP, Design patterns, Data structures etc.\xa0

  • Understanding of single page application (SPA) design patterns\xa0

  • Experience consuming RESTful web services\xa0

  • Experience with front-end build tools, such as Webpack Git version control\xa0

  • Very proficient touch-typing speed

  • MacOSX knowledge

    And it would be great (but not essential) if you have...

  • Good understanding of developing in accordance with WCAG specifications
  • Good understanding of ES6
  • Good understanding of basic SEO code best practices
  • Understanding Deploying and managing internal and external websites within AWS public cloud environment and DevOps, or Cpanel / Apache
  • Unix/Linux; basic commands.
  • Hands on experience in writing unit tests
  • Providing insight into the design process for efficient UX development
  • Basic understanding SASS or similar



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Working with senior team to deliver industry-leading website projects
  • Experimenting with new and better ways to do things
  • Having direct input into the best strategy for completing a project
  • Ensure high levels of communication are maintained
  • Eliminating cross-browser & device bugs



PERKS


  • Office:\xa0Think Google, we have a modern co-working space in Collingwood with Fussball, arcade games, a garden, free coffee, free beer on tap, free cereal & fruit, yoga & meditation classes! Want to see a video of our space? http://bit.ly/2M5mrkJ
  • Training:\xa0We are always investing in the education of our team, with allowances for learning in a form that best suits you (research, books, Udemy, courses, seminars etc).
  • Latest Gear:\xa0Don't deal with a crappy old PC, we have a brand new iMac for you to work on.
  • Fridays:\xa0We head to the pub for lunch and love an afternoon drink with our co-working neighbours.



PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE


  • Degree or Diploma not mandatory, but you must have a history of learning. Either through General Assembly or online training like Udemy.
  • Computer Science background would be helpful.



REMUNERATION


  • Dependent on experience.



WANT IN?


Just apply through Linkedin and we'll be in touch with next steps.


We will be reviewing all applications at the end of the 30 day period, and will get in touch with successful applicants.


Thank you, we look forward to reviewing your application!

851947640:
[

SharePoint Developer

Company Name Kinetic IT Company Location Melbourne CBD, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 52 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Us:

Kinetic IT has grown to become one of Australia's leading ICT managed services providers over the last 20 years, with over 1100 staff getting their teeth into large and complex environments across the country. We have offices four major Australian capitals and cater to a customer-base that spans a range of industry sectors, including government, corporate, resources and utilities.

At Kinetic IT, we recognise that our people are at the core of our success - that's why we make maintaining our values and culture a priority. Not satisfied with the status quo, our people are proud to deliver award-winning customer service and enjoy taking on new challenges as the IT industry continues to evolve. As an employer, we encourage on the job training & development and like our staff to feel empowered. We have a work-life balance culture and we like to celebrate with sponsored social events.

About the Role:

This role will see you imbedded in of one of Kinetic ITs largest project environments working to deliver cutting edge technical solutions. Working in a small, dedicated team of technical and customer service professionals you will be responsible for the development of a large-scale customer SharePoint environment. Your primary responsibilities will be consulting, providing business analytics, developing and maintaining the SharePoint environment. In this role you will work autonomously to develop and drive the enterprise environment from scratch.

To fill this requirement, we are seeking a talented Application Developer with SharePoint experience and an understanding of infrastructure and coding. You will demonstrate familiarity with HTML5 and PowerShell with a desire to own the process from end to end. Importantly, you will enjoy creating solutions, have a knack for consulting with a focus on customer experience and stakeholder engagement, with a proven track record in troubleshooting complex problems at an enterprise level.

Sound like your kind of role? You'll just need some of the following:



  • Experience in a similar position in an enterprise class environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • A strong customer focus to assist with negotiating for the right services for our customer needs
  • Ability to lead the SharePoint platform through business discussion into design and implementation
  • Ability to build authentic and lasting relationships with stakeholders and your team
  • Extensive experience in the following technologies - SharePoint Online, Project Server, SQL Server, Office 365, PowerShell
  • Australian Citizenship - required for AGSVA baseline clearance

How to Apply:

Check out our website at www.kineticit.com.au. Then, if you think we're your kind of company, click on the 'Apply Now' button. The best bit? Registering your details gives you the added benefit of being considered for not just the role advertised, but possibly for other roles (current and future) with Kinetic IT.

If you have any problems with the application form on this ad, you can also send your application directly to careers@kineticit.com.au and quote ref 4517 .

Industry

  • Information Technology and Services

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Consulting
  • Distribution
  • Engineering

The Role

In the role of a Facility Coordinator you will be responsible for coordinating the effective and efficient day to day operations of a specified Council community facility. You will need to ensure the service and facility is flexible, responsive and supportive to community needs while being safe and secure.

You will also support the Community Development Officers with the exploration, development and implementation of appropriate community strengthening activities within the facility and precinct.

You Will Have

 About you
  • Proven ability to successfully coordinate day to day operations of a community facility
  • A minimum two years’ experience within a complex administrative and community customer service delivery environment
  • Highly effective interpersonal skills, including the ability to work inclusively with diverse stakeholders to deliver appropriate and collaborative outcomes

851600644:
[

Account Coordinator - TMT sector (Technology, Media and Telecommunications)

Company Name KPMG Australia Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 60 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Exciting Account Coordinator Opportunity in our TMT (Technology, Media and Telecommunications) sector
  • Work for a market leading professional services firm
  • Value Diversity? It's what sets us apart

KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow. We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities.

KPMG's continued success depends on its ability to win large opportunities with both existing and new clients. We have an opportunity for an exceptional candidate to join our TMT sector as an Account Coordinator based in Melbourne. The primary focus of this role is to provide effective account coordination support to one of the key TMT Strategic Accounts. Also, this role will support the National Technology, Media and Telecommunications Leader to gain broader exposure within this sector.

Your role

As an Account Coordinator, you will deliver results by
  • Providing operational support and manage the day to day running of our key corporate account
  • The central point of contact for our corporate account in terms of the commercial, engagement and procurement processes, and escalating issues where required.
  • Working with the Business Development Manager to manage the team workflow to ensure all account deliverables are actioned within agreed timeframes and are to a high standard
  • Supporting the Business Development Manager to deliver client focussed meetings by pulling together a Client focused agenda and present relevant market information to our corporate client
  • Developing a network with other Account Coordinators/Managers to suggest opportunities to replicate/leverage best practice activities and solutions
  • Working with the Business Development Manager to ensure on-going review of our corporate clients strategies/annual reports/investor reports in order to provide insights into the client strategy
  • Managing the maintenance of client lists in our CRM system and thought leadership roll-outs with EA/PA's, work closely with the TMT Marketing Manager
  • Managing the monthly procurement reporting process, including the review and challenge the inputs from the team and capture the value add in order to present to our client.
  • Supporting the TMT Marketing Manager in executing client events and thought leadership to drive external profile and growth in TMT
  • Reporting, customer relationship management and assisting the TMT Sector Leader to drive engagement within the TMT community.

You will bring to the role

In order to be successful in this role you will require
  • Degree Qualified, Preferably Business/Commerce, Marketing/Communications
  • High level of English literacy. Excellent writing, speaking and editing skills
  • Experience project managing activities with tight deadlines and multiple stakeholders
  • Account management experience highly preferred
  • Experience drafting and turning around tailored and succinct communications
  • Experience in a professional services or large complex matrix organisations an advantage
  • Experience dealing with stakeholders at a senior level and with considerable level of autonomy
  • Good use of CRM systems and other tools to gather information and report/develop insights
  • Intermediate to Advanced Excel, PowerPoint and Word skills.


What We Offer You

We offer rewarding careers for outstanding professionals, ongoing learning and development opportunities, a collaborative and inclusive culture, and flexible and agile work practices that focus on our people's wellbeing to drive innovation and entrepreneurship. We also believe that our business plays a distinct and vital role in helping solve important social and environmental issues; and use our unique skills and expertise to help create positive and lasting impacts for our communities.

We believe diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. We are consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and our inclusive culture promotes the development of our people irrespective of gender, ethnicity, generation, flexible work status, family circumstances, sexual orientation or disability.

This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of KPMG and its ongoing success. So if you want a career where you can use your deep expertise to deliver real results, talk to us first.

Please apply for this position by submitting your confidential application online.

Industry

  • Financial Services
  • Management Consulting

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Business Development
